column18: 1 = Occasional grimace or frown; withdrawn or disinterested; appears sad or worried.
column19: 2 = Consistent grimace or frown; frequent/constant quivering chin, clenched jaw; distressed-looking face; expression of fright or panic.

column17: 0 = Normal position or relaxed; usual tone and motion to limbs
column19: 2 = Kicking, or legs drawn up; marked increase in spasticity, constant tremors or jerking.

column17: 0 = Lying quietly, normal position, moves easily; regular, rhythmic respirations.
column18: 1 = Squirming, shifting back and forth, tense or guarded movements; mildly agitated (e.g., head back and forth, aggression); shallow, splinting respirations, intermittent sighs
column19: 2 = Arched, rigid or jerking; severe agitation; head banging; shivering (not rigors); breath holding, gasping, or sharp intake of breaths, severe splinting.

column18: 1 = Moans or whimpers; occasional complaint; occasional verbal outburst or grunt
column19: 2 = Crying steadily, screams or sobs, frequent complaints; repeated outbursts, constant grunting.

column18: 1 = Reassured by occasional touching, hugging, or being talked to. Distractible
column19: 2 = Difficult to console or comfort; pushing away caregiver, resisting care or comfort measures.
